main event: A civilian observer spotted a light in the sky near Clovis, New Mexico on September 1, 1964 around 0032Z.
interesting points: The object did not appear to have any distinguishable parts or chassis formation and was only visible through binoculars.

During the first 6-10 minutes, the light was steady and remained stationary. Over the next 6-10 minutes, the light went below the horizon, then reappeared above the horizon but was smaller and dimmer.
The object appeared to be gaining altitude while growing smaller and dimmer.
The object had a slight amber color at the bottom and emitted small sparks of light.
The object presented a spotlight-like appearance when viewed from an angle.
sighted object: a steady, stationary light in the sky that changed in size and brightness over time
